physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient was awake, alert, and pleasant. Normal speech but mild dysarthria was noted. Weakness on the right side of the face. The palate was elevated symmetrically, and the tongue protruded along the midline. Continuous twitching of the right lower facial muscles. Normal muscle bulk, tone, and strength in the left arm and leg. In the right arm, strength was 4/5 proximally with little movement of fingers or wrist and distal-muscle spasticity. Strength in the right leg was 4+/5 with slightly increased reflexes. Mildly hemiparetic gait.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Over the next 6 months, twitching was constant in the right side of the face and nearly continuous in the right arm. Weakness of the right leg and arm increased. The gait became more hemiparetic despite continued medical therapy.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Magnetoencephalography (MEG) revealed seizure activity in the left frontal lobe, with discharge predominantly in the posterior left frontal cortex. Continuous right facial twitching and evidence of the right hemisphere being dominant for language.

A 24-hour EEG showed a focus of continuous right facial twitching in the left frontal area with a broad electrical field involving the entire left hemisphere. It recorded six generalized tonicâ€“clonic seizures characterized by spike-and-wave discharges.

Post-surgical observation showed the patient had slower psychomotor function but was immediately able to follow commands and name objects. He had preserved ability to move his right arm and minimal movement in his right leg. The epilepsia partialis continua was absent.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: During the following days, tone returned in the right leg, and by 2 weeks after the procedure, he was walking with assistance and using his right arm.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient's mood and speech returned to baseline; strength continued to improve.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: He was seizure-free and underwent successful tapering off of medications within six months post-operation.
